Sequence Information.Peptide Name: L-K6 L5W (T-1CEb analog, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.31%) toL-K6K: 46%, L: 15%, I: 23%.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 2.50 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 1.56 uM), E. faecium (MIC 2.50 uM), B. cereus (MIC 5.00 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 3.13 uM), Gram- E. coli (MIC 2.50 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 9.73 uM), K.pneumoniae (MIC >100 uM), E.cloacae (MIC >100 uM), and P.mirabilis (MIC >100 uM).In vitro toxicity: human RBC, HC50 >500 uM (not hemo.lytic).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in SDS micelles or 50% TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Bi X, Wang C, Ma L, Sun Y, Shang D. 2013
Literature Information.Title: Investigation of the role of tryptophan residues in cationic antimicrobial peptides to determine the mechanism of antimicrobial action.
